text: The United States' regulations 'are among the most difficult in the world.'
Says her campaign platform includes the 'biggest investment in new, good-paying jobs since World War II.'
Says that when San Francisco banned plastic grocery bags, 'you saw the number of instances of people going to the ER with things like salmonella and other related illnesses' spike.
'Back door gun control is in full effect in the United States' due to 'Obama’s Environmental Protection Agency.'
On disaster aid offsets
'West has raised $2 million from those that would leave our beaches in ruins, end Social Security and Medicare, and give corporations free reign.'
The loan guarantee program that helped Solyndra 'was a program that was supported by President Bush.'
'There is no reason for these massive, deadly and costly forest fires in California except that forest management is so poor.'
Says Scott Pruitt’s security spending was 'somewhat more' than his predecessor.
'Bill White ... supports the ‘ObamaCare’ socialized medicine plan, as well as ‘Cap and Trade’ legislation that would kill thousands of Texas jobs.'
'Obama has jumped the shark and ordered the ocean closed!'
Says U.S. House candidate Carlos Curbelo 'supported raising flood insurance rates.'
'The White House removed its climate change web page. And the healthcare, civil rights and LGBT sections.'
keywords: civil rights,climate change,gays and lesbians,health care,technology

text: The EPA 'wants to hire 230,000 new government regulators that will cost the taxpayer $21 billion.'
'Texas ranks: #1 in worker deaths, #1 carbon emissions, #50 in high school graduates, #50 in funding for mental health patients.'

'Due to a flaw in the 1995 Outer Continental Shelf Deep Water Royalty Relief Act numerous oil companies are now drilling in the Gulf of Mexico in federal lands and paying no royalties to the federal government.'
'Lake Erie supports nearly 10 percent of Ohio's jobs and generates $750 million in state and local taxes.'
The United States 'spends more on potato chips than we do on ALL energy R&D.'
The RESTORE Act started as an 'effort to dedicate as much BP fine money as possible towards Gulf Coast restoration' but now 'could steer money to places like the Great Lakes and West Coast.'
'Congressman (Tom) Cotton is the only Arkansan in Congress -- Democrat or Republican -- to vote against disaster relief five times.'
Says Newt Gingrich 'co-sponsored a bill with Nancy Pelosi that would have given $60 million a year to a U.N. program supporting China’s brutal one-child policy.'
'Black lung cases are at a 25-year high.'
'The federal government owns about half of the West, yet it continues to acquire more land.'
On the use of presidentially appointed commissions.
The National Science Foundation awarded $700,000 to fund a climate change musical.
Says President Barack Obama’s homeland security budget had '$16 million to fight climate change' but 'didn't have a line item to fight violent extremism.'
Says Sen. Thad Cochran 'voted to spend hundreds of millions of dollars on ... the Bridge to Nowhere in Alaska instead of shifting the money to repair a bridge damaged by Hurricane Katrina.'
'Even Roger Williams National Memorial in my home state of Rhode Island attracted nearly 51,000 visitors in 2011, with non local visitors adding more than $3.2 million to the local economy.'
'At $93 trillion, the Green New Deal would cost more than the entire recorded spending of the U.S. since the Constitution went into effect in 1789.'
Says U.S. Senate hopeful Tammy Baldwin voted for a $1 trillion stimulus bill that included a wasteful '$800,000 to replace light bulbs.'
Louisiana gets 'not one single penny' from Gulf Coast offshore oil revenues.
'Subsidies for oil and gas companies make up 88 percent of all federal subsidies. Just cutting the oil and gas subsidies out would save the U.S. government $45 billion every year.'
Says Lloyd Doggett voted for the health care, stimulus and cap-and-trade bills.
keywords: cap and trade,climate change,economy,health care,message machine 2010

text: Royalties for oil and other energy sources are the 'second-largest revenue source to the federal government after the IRS.'
'There are more oil rigs in operation in the United States than the rest of the world combined.'

'Right now every single one of the (oil) companies here today and dozens of others are drilling for free in the Gulf of Mexico on leases that will cost American taxpayers more than $50 billion in lost royalties.'
A bill to advance the Keystone XL Pipeline 'is an earmark' under House rules.
On subsidies for ethanol production.
Says Ron Paul insisted FEMA should be shut down.
'This president spends 30 times as much money on global warming research as he does on weather forecasting and warning.'
Says he 'voted for disaster relief and full funding of FEMA.'
Says 3,000 people 'did not die' in two hurricanes that hit Puerto Rico. That death toll estimate was 'done by Democrats.'
A Trump administration proposal for the Interior Department 'is the largest investment in our public lands infrastructure in our nation's history.'
'It's important to pay attention to the Russian spy drama, but let's not ignore the fact that the following (10) bills have been introduced' in the House.
'Three of our cities are among the top five worst cities in the U.S. for asthma.'
Says she couldn't take stimulus money because it required 'universal building codes.'
